intro: Oxytropis interposita, commonly known as the Sierra lappé, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its upright growth habit and compound leaves. The plant produces small, pea-like flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It thrives in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to arid environments. Oxytropis interposita plays a role in stabilizing soil and providing food for local wildlife.
